articles.title: 'Nobody is getting off the hook' Trump says of tariffs
articles.description: A Trump administration official said Sunday that tariff exemptions on cell phones and other electronic devices are only temporary, adding to an already confusing situation around the United States' economic policy.
articles.content:
Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick speaks with reporters outside the White House in Washington, DC, in March. Lutnick said Sunday that trade tariffs 'are not up for negotiation.' Photo by Yuri Gripas/UPI | License Photo

articles.author: The Guardian
articles.title: Trump official who oversaw dismantling of USAID leaves US state department
articles.description: Under Pete Marocco’s lead, nearly all USAID staff was fired, with funding slashed and contractors dismissed
articles.content:
Pete Marocco, the Trump administration official who played a major role in dismantling the US Agency for International Development (USAID), has left the state department, a US official said on Sunday.

articles.title: Donald Trump considers pausing motor tariffs as world economy suffers whiplash
articles.description: A statement from the president hinted at yet another round of reversals on tariffs.
articles.content:
Donald Trump has suggested that he might temporarily exempt the motor industry from tariffs he previously imposed on the sector, to give car makers time to adjust their supply chains.

articles.description: US president Donald Trump has said he is considering imposing tariffs on pharmaceutical imports in the 'not too distant future'
articles.content:
US president Donald Trump has said he is considering imposing tariffs on pharmaceutical imports in the "not too distant future".

articles.author: BreakingNews.ie
articles.title: China’s Xi says there are ‘no winners’ in tariff war as he visits Southeast Asia
articles.description: Although Donald Trump has paused some tariffs, China was the outlier, as he has kept in place 145% tariffs on the world’s second-largest economy.
articles.content:
China’s leader, Xi Jinping, started a week of diplomacy in Southeast Asia with a visit to Vietnam.
Monday’s move signalled China’s commitment to global trade just after US President Donald Trump upended the global economy with his latest tariff moves... [3441 chars]

articles.author: BreakingNews.ie
articles.title: Trump says CBS and 60 Minutes should ‘pay a big price’ for going after him
articles.description: He called on Federal Communications Commission chairman Brendan Carr to impose maximum fines and punishment.
articles.content:
US President Donald Trump bitterly attacked 60 Minutes shortly after the CBS programme broadcast stories on Ukraine and Greenland.
He said the network was out of control and should “pay a big price” for going after him on Sunday.

articles.title: US stock futures rise amid temporary tariff exemptions for tech products
articles.description: Stock futures rose Sunday after a temporary reprieve from tariffs on electronic imports from China by the Trump administration.
articles.content:
CNN —
Stock futures rose Sunday after a temporary reprieve from tariffs on electronic imports from China by the Trump administration.

articles.author: The Guardian
articles.title: Hedge fund billionaire says US may face ‘worse than a recession’ from Trump tariffs
articles.description: Ray Dalio’s comments come after rocky week across stock markets after policies including 145% tariff raise on China
articles.content:
Billionaire investor Ray Dalio said that he is worried the US will experience “something worse than a recession” as a result of Donald Trump’s trade policies.
